Igna

Goddess of Light, Fire, The Phoenix, Defeat and Rebirth

Common Symbols: a flame, a phoenix

Divine Domain(s): Light, Grave

She was dead, now returned to life. A cult, known as the Unadorned Ones or Radiant Ones stole Ignaâ€™s soma and created their own religion. She was reborn when her champion killed the avatar of the Radiant Ones in the autumn of G26 (24 years ago). Now Igna once again brings fire and light to those that pray to her. Her time in torpor brought her close to death giving her insight past the grave. Unlike the titans, the relentless destroyers, Igna's fire burns away the old to make way for the new.

Followers of Igna are commonly passionate about a cause. They are missionaries with specific goals in mind. They are famous for being willing to *burn* away the old to allow them to accomplish the new. This is done in the name of Igna and the greater good.

Cleric's of Igna are fierce on the battlefield. The more adept ones can hurl balls of fire that destroy the morale of the enemy. These clerics are known for their bright armour and shields as well as their colourful robes. They most often use yellows, oranges and reds.

The phoenix is often associated with Igna.
